all_or_nothing_thinking: All or nothing thinking. Yes, hrrrm.
all_or_nothing_thinking_explanation: No room for middle ground this distortion happens when we have. That a small fault in ourselves means weâ€™re fundamentally rotten or otherwise terrible if we think, weâ€™re likely engaging in all or nothing thinking.
all_or_nothing_thinking_thought: I bombed the interview, be unhirable I must. Yes, hrrmmm.
catastrophizing_explanation: If weâ€™re taking a small problem and blowing it way out of proportion, weâ€™re catastrophizing. Did you make a small mistake at work and are dreading if someone found out even though itâ€™s nothing serious? Youâ€™re probably catastrophizing.
catastrophizing_thought: Jittery i'm feeling, having a heart attack I might be. Yes, hrrmmm.
emotional_reasoning_explanation_1: "I feel, be true therefore it must. Yourself justifying the "danger" of something innocuous because youâ€™re afraid of it " if you find, then youâ€™re likely engaging in emotional reasoning. We are things arenâ€™t dangerous because weâ€™re afraid of them and weâ€™re not awful just because we may think. Yes, hrrrm.
emotional_reasoning_explanation_2: Often hard to recognize this one is. Some effort to recognize when your emotional mind is taking the logical reins it takes.
emotional_reasoning_thought: Guilty I feel, have done something bad therefore I must. Yes, hrrmmm.
fortune_telling_explanation: This distortion happens when we predict the future. We often overestimate our abilities to predict what will happen. For evidence that it will occur frequently we'll worry that something might happen and then start to look.
fortune_telling_thought: On will crash the plane i'm about to get. Yrsssss.
labeling_explanation: One characteristic of a person and applying it to the whole person if we're taking, we're labeling. If someone brushed us off, a "jerk they might not be," maybe they're just in a hurry. A mistake doesn't mean we're a "failure this applies to ourselves as well; just because we make. "
labeling_thought: I failed a test, so I'm a bad student.
magnification_of_the_negative_explanatio: If youâ€™re judging a situation based entirely on the negative parts and not considering the positive parts, youâ€™re likely magnifying the negative. If youâ€™re constantly berating yourself for bombing a job interview, youâ€™re probably filtering out all the experience you gained from that interview. Yes, hrrmmm.
magnification_of_the_negative_thought: Healthy this week I ate, but I skipped my run.
mind_reading_explanation: Thinking about us if we're worried about what someone else is, minds we're attempting to read. You what they're thinking unless someone tells, absolutely no way of knowing you have. So why assume the worst?
mind_reading_thought: I was rude to george I think, i'll bet he hates me.
minimization_of_the_positive_explanation: Happening to us if we downplay the good things that are, we're minimizing the positive. 100% as planned even if our day didn't go, that the 60% that did go right should be ignored it doesn't mean. Yes, hrrrm.
minimization_of_the_positive_thought: My presentation many people liked, the intro but I stumbled giving, bad so it was. Yes, hrrmmm.
other_blaming_explanation_1: Be the fault of someone if a bad situation must, we're other-blaming. If you failed an exam and you're blaming the teacher, you're directing your energy to the wrong place. You off on the highway someone cut? If you honk your horn, flip them off, and stew, that helping how is? Off and mad now you're cut!
other_blaming_explanation_2: You have to blame yourself for every negative situation this doesn't mean. Have to blame anyone you do not. To be at fault if you let the situation pass without attaching blame no one has. Yrsssss.
other_blaming_thought: Taking too long in line and i'm going to be late that jerk is! Yes, hrrrm.
over_generalization_explanation: Conclusions based on just one example if we draw, we're over generalizing. You're "bad" at presenting if you bombed a presentation and assume that means, you're over-generalizing.
over_generalization_thought: No one asked me to dance, so no one ever will. Hmm.
self_blaming_explanation: If you're attributing a negative situation entirely to yourself, you're self-blaming. Have to be responsible for every bad thing that happens you do not. Caught in traffic and you're berating yourself for not leaving earlier if you're getting, you're self-blaming. Would you treat someone else this way?
self_blaming_thought: Failing in school my son is, have failed him I must.
should_statements_explanation_1: Have if you're assigning someone abilities they do not, you're using faulty "should" statements. For example, a fear of flying and are telling yourself "i shouldn't be afraid of this if you have, there's nothing wrong with the airplane! An undue burden on yourself " you're putting. A fear of flying you have! A fear of flying to be afraid flying it's normal for people who have!
should_statements_explanation_2: It out loud; that's the point should statements can seem nonsensical when you say! They're illogical! Yes, hrrmmm.
should_statements_thought: I'm an adult, these mental issues I shouldn't have. Yrsssss.

payment.ios_explanation: Payment will be charged to your Apple ID account at the confirmation of purchase. The subscription automatically renews unless it is canceled at least 24 hours before the end of the current period. Your account will be charged for renewal within 24 hours prior to the end of the current period. You can manage and cancel your subscriptions by going to your App Store account settings after purchase.
